title: X55VD no power
message:
Asus X55VD
KBC: IT8517

I have 3V at power button. They goes to 0V when press power. 
It charges main battery, altought I have only 3V there and goes up.
I dont have any schamatic for IT8517 so cannot check if powrtbtn# goes from KBC to PCH. Is there any schematic that I can use?

title: X55VD no power
message: Charge light turning orange? Liquid spill?

title: X55VD no power
message:
No liquid spill. This board have 6 leds. All are off with battery or ac adapter.

I have 19V at B+ main rail after both mosfets.
BVAT (battery rail) - 2.71V with battery and ac adapter.
BVAT (battery rail) - 3V with ac adapter.

BQ24725 - pin5 = 2.98V

title: X55VD no power
message:
So why do you tell me the battery is charging then?
First suspect would be the BIOS at this point. Read the old one and upload it here.

title: X55VD no power
message:
lot of laptop Asus at my work have this problem. I am often able to resolve it by flashing the bios. 

Duke how is this possible that many laptop, Acer, Asus ... have this problem ?
Intel me region caused this issue and why 

MDY what is model of motherboard and rev ? i have bios dump

title: X55VD no power
message: Just use his original and merge it with the Asus update. Unless you have access to Asus SIP, there you can download the complete BIOS with clean ME.

title: X55VD no power
message:
Bios was missing... I dont know how... I found a bios for this model and I put a new winbond 8MB chip and firmware. 
Now I have:

vbat: 10.7V with battery
vbat: 11.40V with battery and ac adapter.

Still doesnot power. All 6 leds are still off. I know you will say somebody tocuh it. Goes to the trash, but I still want to try something.

title: X55VD no power
message: Who knows what the hell is going on at this point. Dead KBC, missing components. Not worth my time.

title: X55VD no power
message:
Ok, will replace KBC and then goes to the trash.
What I am not sure is, if KBC is dead this could be the reason that all 6 leds are off?

title: X55VD no power
message: I checked several schematics and I have noticed that all leds come from KBC. So if charging leds are off this mean there is a problem with battery charger/KBC/BIOS. Is that correct?

title: X55VD no power
message: Probably, but who knows. Save yourself the headache and $10 of a KBC and buy a working board for $80, problem solved.

title: X55VD no power
message: I dont repair for end customer and my top price for most cases is 100$ for laptops like Asus. Should try something before.
